geodesicparams.utilities module

Provides mini helper procedures utilized throughout various modules.

Helper functions include sorting procedures for the roots of polynomials, clearing directories, checking if a number is in a list, and numerically evaluating symbolic numbers in a list.

geodesicparams.utilities.clear_directory(dir)[source]

Remove all files in a directory.

Parameters:

dir (string) – A string representing the path to the directory to be cleared.

Return type:

None

geodesicparams.utilities.eval_roots(lst)[source]

Evaluate the symbolic roots of a polynomial numerically.

Parameters:

lst (list) – A list of complex or real numbers representing the roots of a polynomial symbolically.

Returns:

lst – The original list of numbers evaluated numerically instead of symbolically.

Return type:

list

geodesicparams.utilities.extract_multiple_elems(lst)[source]

Remove duplicate elements from <lst> and store them in a separate list.

Parameters:

lst (list) – A list of complex or real numbers.

Returns:

  • clean_list (list) – The original list, but with duplicate elements removed.

  • mult_elems (list) – A list of the duplicate elements removed from <lst>.

geodesicparams.utilities.find_next(expression, lst)[source]

Find a number in <lst> that is closest to the value of <expression>.

Parameters:

  • expression (real) – A real number.

  • lst (list) – A list of real numbers.

Returns:

The number in <lst> closest to <expression>.

Return type:

real

geodesicparams.utilities.inlist(element, lst)[source]

Given a complex number <element>, find what index the element is located at in <lst>. Return -1 if <element> is not in <lst>.

Parameters:

  • element (complex) – A complex number.

  • lst (list) – A list of complex or real numbers.

Returns:

result – The index at which <element> is located in <lst>.

Return type:

integer

geodesicparams.utilities.separate_zeros(zeros)[source]

Seperate the zeros of a polynomial into its real roots and complex roots.

Parameters:

zeros (list) – A list of complex and real numbers representing the roots of the polynomial.

Returns:

  • realNS (list) – A list of real numbers ordered from least to greatest.

  • complexNS (list) – A list of complex numbers ordered from least to greatest.
